page.title: 04HEAD TEACHERS,FENSTANTON
page.content: In 1728{Joseph Ellis}died and left Â£200 in his will to start off a school for the poor children of the village. In 1819 a village master earned Â£30 a year.Here is a list of all the head teachers. 1810{Stephen Harding}_ ten years 1820{Mr Blench}_31 years 1851{William Peck}_19 years 1870{George Bell/Jane Peters}_10 years 1880{Mr Hicks}_ 34 years 1914{Mr Quick}_20 years 1928{Mr Smith}_14 years Early 1934{Mr Darlow}_ 17 years 1945{Mr Anderson-died 1952-7years 1952{Mr Cannel}_16 years {Mr Hicks}has been headmaster for the longest so far. { Mr Wallace}took over in 1968.He has been here for 17 years.Before Mr Wallace was here there were about 120 children, now there are 348.
